chat.server

Class ThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • chat.server.ThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class ThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork
extends Object
implements Runnable
    This class defines the main of the chat server. It configures the server, connects to existing chat servers, waits for connections from other chat servers and from chat clients, and forwards chat messages received from chat clients to other 'local' chat clients and to the other chat servers. The chat servers can be organised into a network topology forming cycles since the method forward is only called when the message to forward has not already been received and forwarded.
    Author:
    chris, Denis Conan

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork

        public ThreadReadMessagesFromNetwork(Server server,
                                     Selector selector,
                                     SelectionKey acceptClientKey,
                                     ServerSocketChannel listenChanClient,
                                     SelectionKey acceptServerKey,
                                     ServerSocketChannel listenChanServer,
                                     State state)
        initialises the collection attributes and the state of the server, and creates the channels that are accepting connections from clients and servers.
        Parameters:
        server - the reference to the server.
        selector - the selector.
        acceptClientKey - the selection key for accepting client connections.
        listenChanClient - the server socket channel for accepting client connections.
        acceptServerKey - the selection key for accepting server connections.
        listenChanServer - the server socket channel for accepting server connections.
        state - the reference to the state objec of the server where all the attributes are stored.
